intro: Ardisia valida, commonly known as the glossy woodbine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy red berries. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are glossy and dark green, while its flowers are small and white or pink. The berries are an important food source for various birds and mammals in its native habitat.
